result.execSummary:
The defendant Jordan S. May was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of THC, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(e).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Defendant shall not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961. 
Defendant shall not go upon any premises where he/she has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present.

Defendant to pay supervision fees as determined by DOC. 
Defendant shall submit to any assessments and fully participate in any counseling deemed appropriate by the Agent and abide by any treatment recommendations. 
Defendant shall possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician. 
Defendant shall obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 48 hours of any new or changing prescriptions.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea
Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.addlTxt:
To Br. 2 from J.J.J. 
To Br. 2 from R.R.M. 
To Br. 2 from E.M.

Defendant Jordan S. May in court (in custody) with attorney Kate Frigo Drury.  
Veronica Isherwood appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Statements by Atty Drury regarding victim statements and employment. 
Statements by DA Isherwood. 
Court orders defendant to serve 120 days jail, concurrent with Huber privileges on cases 15CM151 & 15CM153. 
Defendant given 78 days credit.

Letter from Department of Corrections
Violation/Revocation Summary
Client Account Inquiry
Sentencing hearing on revocation on March 16, 2017 at 01:45 pm.

Defendant Jordan S. May in court with attorney Michael Ross Blum.  
John P. Snider appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights filed with the Court. 
Defendant advised of rights, waives rights and enters no contest pleas to count 1 in 15CM151 and counts 2 & 3 in 15CM153. 
Per DA Snider, State has completed witness responsibilities. 
Court accepts pleas and finds defendant guilty regarding count 1 in 15CM151 and counts 2 & 3 in 15CM153. 
14CM418 is dismissed and read in as well as remaining counts in 15CM151 & 15CM153. 
Court orders sentence withheld, probation 2 years, concurrent.  
Conditions:
- pay costs/supervision fees
- submit to assessments/counseling and abide by recommendations
- not possess any illegal drugs or substances/drug paraphernalia as defined in Chapter 961 
- not go upon any premises where he has cause to believe such contraband as defined in Ch. 961 may be present 
- possess prescription medications only by valid prescription, and take in the manner and method as prescribed by a physician
-  obtain prescriptions from one pharmacy and notify Agent within 48 hours of any new or changing prescriptions 
Defendant provided with notice of appeal rights.
